name: 3dISC - Voxelwise Inter-Subject Correlation Analysis
author: AFNI Team
description: Program for Voxelwise Inter-Subject Correlation (ISC) Analysis using linear mixed-effects modeling.

inputs.description: Output file name. For AFNI format, provide prefix only, with no view+suffix needed.
inputs.name: Output file prefix

inputs.description: Specify the number of jobs to run concurrently. Choose 1 for a single-processor computer.
inputs.name: Number of jobs

inputs.description: Process voxels inside this mask only. Default is no masking.
inputs.name: Mask file

inputs.description: Specify the model structure for all the variables. The expression FORMULA with more than one variable has to be surrounded within quotes.
inputs.name: Model structure formula

inputs.description: Specify centering values for quantitative variables identified under -qVars. Multiple centers are separated by commas without spaces and should be within quotes.
inputs.name: Quantitative variable centers

inputs.description: Identify quantitative variables (or covariates). The list should be comma-separated and within quotes.
inputs.name: Quantitative variables

inputs.description: Perform Fisher transformation on the response variable (input files) if it is a correlation value.
inputs.name: Fisher transformation flag

inputs.description: Use AFNI's C io functions (default) or R's io functions.
inputs.name: IO Functions

inputs.description: List the data structure with a header as the first line. Has to occur last in the script.
inputs.name: Data table
